summary: This document details a request for case funding related to an undercover meeting involving Alfredo Rodriguez, an employee of Jeffrey Epstein, and attorney Bradley James Edwards. The meeting was arranged to discuss documents Rodriguez claimed were pertinent to a civil case against Epstein, which he was attempting to sell for $50,000 despite being under subpoena to provide them.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is mentioned as an employee of Jeffrey Epstein who is trying to sell documents related to the civil case against Epstein.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.context: Edwards is representing four female individuals suing Epstein and is involved in the deposition of Rodriguez regarding documents pertinent to the case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee of Epstein and is being deposed by Edwards, who is representing Epstein's accusers.

events.title: Undercover Meeting
events.description: An undercover meeting was arranged between Alfredo Rodriguez and an FBI undercover employee at the Hilton Suites in Boca Raton, FL.

events.title: Contact Initiation
events.description: Bradley James Edwards was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez regarding documents related to the civil case against Epstein.

locations: Hilton Suites, 7920 Glades Road, Boca Raton, FL
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez is attempting to sell documents related to the Epstein case for $50,000.
Rodriguez is under a federal subpoena to provide documents but is refusing to comply without payment.
Bradley James Edwards is representing four female plaintiffs in a civil lawsuit against Epstein.
An undercover meeting was arranged to discuss the documents Rodriguez claims are pertinent to the case.
The document requests funding for hotel expenses related to the undercover operation.
